STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER LANS ING ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 31, 2025
Janice Black-Moore
Spectrum Human Services
16250 Northland Dr.
Southfield, MI, 48075-5205
Re: License #: CB630201417
SI #: 2025SIC0000396
Dear Ms. Black-Moore:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violation identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Development of Service Plan
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12418 (2) An agency shall complete written service
Section plans for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
Description (a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency has not completed an Initial Service Plan or Updated
Service Plans for the parent.
Investigation On 2/24/25 Complainant reported the agency did not complete
an Initial Service Plan (ISP) or any Updated Service Plans (USP)
regarding Parent 1 and Child A.
Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via email on 3/3/25. Complainant
responded and did not have any additional information.
Chief Administrator was contacted via email on 2/25/25 and
notified of the investigation. Chief Administrator reported the
worker for the case was on leave of absence. Program Manager
was covering the case. Additional email contacts occurred with
Chief Administrator on 3/25/25 and 3/26/25 in which they provided
additional case information and documents to DCWL. Chief
Administrator reported on 3/27/25 the case was recently returned
to MDHHS.
Program Manager was interviewed via video call on 3/7/25.
Program Manager confirmed the case worker was on leave of
absence for an unknown amount of time. Regarding the
allegation, Parent 1 had a child in care, and lost parental rights in
March 2024. Child A was then born in April 2024 and entered care
on 5/8/24. Program Manager stated the case had yet to be
adjudicated. However, the agency did complete treatment plans
as required.
MDHHS Worker was contacted via email on 3/25/25. MDHHS
Worker reported she was initially assigned to Parent 1’s case from
5/8/24-5/13/24. The case was then transferred to Spectrum.
MDHHS worker verified Spectrum was assigned at the time the
ISP was due. MDHHS worker provided court orders to verify when
2

the case began and that the child was ordered into custody for
care and supervision.
Documents reviewed:
Case record for Child A, had the following relevant information:
• Court order dated 5/8/24 ordered removal of the child and
placement into MDHHS custody for care and supervision.
• ISP for 5/8/24-5/31/24 was approved 6/4/24.
• USP for 6/1/24-8/29/24 was approved 8/29/24.
• USP 8/30/24-11/26/24 was approved 12/3/24.
• USP 11/20/24-2/17/25 was approved 3/6/25.
Analysis No violation was found as the agency completed an ISP and
subsequent USPs as required by the rule.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Development of Service Plan
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12418 (5) An agency shall involve the child’s
Section parent or parents and the foster parents in the development of
Description service plans to enable the parent or parents and foster parents to
understand the plan for the child and the parents’ and the foster
parent’s role in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-agency
treatment plan with the parent or parents and foster parents. The
agency must inform the parent or parents and foster parent that
the information in the parent-agency treatment plan and any other
information about the child and the child's family is confidential.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency has not provided service plans (treatment plans) to
the parent.
Investigation On 2/24/25 Complainant reported that Parent 1 had not been
provided with any service plans/Parent Agency Treatment Plans
(PATP).
Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via email on 3/3/25. Complainant did
not have any additional information.
Chief Administrator was contacted via email on 2/25/25 and
notified of the investigation. Chief Administrator reported the
worker for the case was on leave of absence. Program Manager
was covering the case in the interim. Additional email contacts
occurred with Chief Administrator on 3/25/25 in which they
3

provided additional case information and documents to DCWL.
Chief Administrator reported on 3/27/25 the case was recently
returned to MDHHS.
Program Manager was interviewed via video call on 3/7/25.
Program Manager confirmed the case worker was on leave of
absence for an unknown amount of time. Program Manager
reported service plans were completed as required and believed
PATPs were signed although she was not certain.
Parent 1 was interviewed by phone on 3/28/25. Parent 1 reported
she last received a copy of a PATP in December 2024. Parent 1
confirmed that she remembered receiving the May 2024 PATP
also. However, she did not receive the August 2024 and February
2025 PATPs. Parent 1 stated she had not spoken with anyone at
the agency since December 2024. However, prior to that, she did
ask the worker for copies of the reports. The worker, whose name
she could not recall, stated the report was not ready and would be
mailed to her upon completion. The report was never received by
Parent 1.
Documents reviewed:
Case record for Child A had the following relevant information:
• Case Service Plans and PATPs were completed on
5/31/24, 8/29/24, 11/26/24 and 2/17/25.
• PATP dated 5/31/24 was signed by Parent 1 on 7/8/24. The
signature line indicated a copy was provided to the parent
for review.
• PATP dated 8/29/24 was not signed by Parent 1.
• PATP dated 11/26/24 was signed by Parent 1 on 12/26/24.
The signature line indicated a copy was provided to the
parent for review.
• PATP dated 2/17/25 was not signed by Parent 1.
• Case contacts were reviewed for documentation regarding
the 8/29/24 and 2/17/25 PATPs. There were no contacts
indicating the PATPs were reviewed with or provided to
Parent 1.
Analysis A violation was found as there was not documentation to show
that two of four PATPs were reviewed with or provided to Parent
1.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
4

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
_ ______________March 28, 2025_______________________
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
March 31, 2025

Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
